text:
Quick suggestion: the error message here was a bit confusing in this context. I don’t know how hard it’d be to do this, but something like “variables can’t start with numbers!” would have been easier to understand.
```
*julia>* 2006jld = load(joinpath(year_save_path, “2006", “2006.jld”))
*ERROR:* syntax: “2006" is not a valid function argument name around REPL[15]:1
``````

elements.text:
Quick suggestion: the error message here was a bit confusing in this context. I don’t know how hard it’d be to do this, but something like “variables can’t start with numbers!” would have been easier to understand.
```
syntax: “2006" is not a valid function argument name around REPL[15]:1

text: You are actually trying to shadow `*` here, so what you wrote is equivalent to `*(2006, jld) = load(...)`. I am not sure what a better error message would look like without making parser changes.

here, so what you wrote is equivalent to
. I am not sure what a better error message would look like without making parser changes.

text: Oh, that's a sneaky problem. Might be worth doing. I'll open an issue and investigate what would have to be done.
